Welcome to PhotoShareApp’s documentation!¶

PhotoShareApp main¶

async main.ban_ips(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The ban_ips function is a middleware function that checks if the client’s IP address is in the banned_ips list. If it is, then we return a JSON response with status code 403 and an error message. Otherwise, we call the next middleware function and return its response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the client’s ip address

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next function in the middleware chain to ban_ips

Returns:

A jsonresponse with a status code of 403 and a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by executing a SQL query to check if it can connect to the database and retrieve data. If it cannot, then an HTTPException is raised with status code 500 (Internal Server Error) and detail message &quot;Error connection to database&quot;. Otherwise, if everything works as expected, then we return {&quot;message&quot;: &quot;Welcome to FastAPI!&quot;}.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.read_root(request: Request)¶

The read_root function is a coroutine that returns an HTML response. The function uses the templates module to render the index.html template, which is located in the templates directory of our project.

Parameters:

request – Request: Pass the request object to the template

Returns:

A templateresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A list of functions that are executed when the application starts

Doc-author:

Trelent

PhotoShareApp repository Comments¶

async src.repository.comments.create_comment(body: CreateCommentModel, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶
The create_comment function creates a comment for the post with the id specified in body.post_id

and returns that comment.

Parameters:

  • body – CreateCommentModel: Get the content and post_id from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the user_id of the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

Returns:

An instance of the comment class

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.comments.delete_comment(body: CommentDeleteModel, user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶
The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.

It takes in a CommentDeleteModel object, which contains the id of the comment to be deleted. The function then checks if the user has enough permissions to delete comments (user_type_id 2 or 3). If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 403 and detail &quot;Not enough permissions&quot;.

Parameters:

  • body – CommentDeleteModel: Get the comment_id from the request body

  • user – User: Check if the user is an admin or moderator

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The deleted comment

async src.repository.comments.update_comment(body: CommentUpdateModel, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶
The update_comment function updates a comment in the database.

It takes a CommentUpdateModel as input, which contains the id of the comment to be updated and its new content. The function also takes two other parameters: current_user and db. The current_user parameter is used to check if the user who wants to update this comment is actually its author, while db is an instance of AsyncSession that we use for querying our database.

Parameters:

  • body – CommentUpdateModel: Get the comment_id and content from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the user id of the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

Returns:

The updated comment

PhotoShareApp repository Posts¶

async src.repository.posts.add_tag_to_post(body: TagUpdate, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession) → Post¶
The add_tag_to_post function adds a tag to the post.
Args:

  • body (TagUpdate): The TagUpdate object containing the name of the post and tags to add.

  • current_user (User): The User object representing who is making this request.

  • db (AsyncSession): A database session for interacting with Postgresql via SQLAlchemy Core.

Parameters:

  • body – TagUpdate: Get the name of the post and tags to add

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is authorized to add tags to a post

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A post with a new tag

async src.repository.posts.create_post(body: PostModel, image_url: str, image_id: str, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶
The create_post function creates a new post in the database.
It takes three arguments:

  • body: The PostModel object that contains the name, content and tags of the post to be created.

  • image_url: The url of an image associated with this post (optional).

  • current_user: A User object representing the user who is creating this post.

Parameters:

  • body – PostModel: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • image_url – str: Pass the image url to the database

  • image_id – str: Store the image id in the database

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A post object

async src.repository.posts.get_post(post_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_post function takes a post_id and an async database session as arguments. It then queries the Post table for the row with that id, and returns it.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: Specify the type of parameter that is expected

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to use

Returns:

A single post

async src.repository.posts.get_posts(db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_posts function returns a list of the most recent 20 posts.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of posts

async src.repository.posts.get_user_post(post_id: int, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶
The get_user_post function is used to get a post by its id.
Args:

  • post_id (int): The id of the post you want to retrieve.

  • current_user (User): The user who is making the request for this function. This will be used to determine if they are an admin or not, and thus whether or not they can see all posts, or just their own posts.

  • db (AsyncSession): An async session object that will be used for querying the database with SQLAlchemy Core syntax.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: Filter the posts by id

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is an admin or not

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A post object with the given id, if it exists

async src.repository.posts.remove_post(post_id: int, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶
The remove_post function removes a post from the database.
Args:

  • post_id (int): The id of the post to be removed.

  • current_user (User): The user who is making this request. This is used to ensure that only the owner of a

  • particular post can remove it, and not other users.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: Get the post from the database

  • current_user – User: Ensure that the user is logged in

  • db – AsyncSession: Connect to the database

Returns:

The post that was removed

async src.repository.posts.update_post(post_id: int, body: PostModel, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶
The update_post function updates a post in the database.
Args:

  • post_id (int): The id of the post to update.

  • body (PostModel): The new data for the specified Post object.

  • current_user (User): The user who is making this request, used to check if they are authorized to make this change.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: Identify the post we want to delete

  • body – PostModel: Get the new values for the post

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is authorized to update the post

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A postmodel object

PhotoShareApp repository Profile¶

async src.repository.profile.get_profile(user: User, db: AsyncSession) → dict¶
The get_profile function returns a dictionary containing the following information:

  • username

  • email

  • avatar (url)

  • comments_count (number of comments made by user)

  • posts_count (number of posts made by user)

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary of user information

async src.repository.profile.update_user_profile(body: UserSchema, user: User, db: AsyncSession) → User | None¶
The update_user_profile function updates a user’s profile information.
Args:

  • body (UserSchema): The UserSchema object containing the new user data.

  • user (User): The User object to be updated.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The updated user object

PhotoShareApp repository Rating¶

async src.repository.rating.create_rating(body, postid, current_user, db)¶
The create_rating function creates a new rating for the post with id = postid.

The value of the rating is given by body.value, and it is created by current_user.

Parameters:

  • body – Get the value of the rating

  • postid – Find the post that is being rated

  • current_user – Get the id of the user who is currently logged in

  • db – Access the database

Returns:

The new rating that was created

async src.repository.rating.delete_rating(post: Post, rating: Rating, db: AsyncSession)¶

The delete_rating function deletes a rating from the database.

Parameters:

  • post – Post: Get the post that is being rated

  • rating – Rating: Specify the rating to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The post object

async src.repository.rating.get_postsratings(_id, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_postsratings function takes in a post id and returns all the ratings for that post.

Parameters:

  • _id – Get the post id from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of all the ratings for a post

async src.repository.rating.get_rating(body, user, db)¶

The get_rating function takes in a body, user, and db. It then creates an SQLAlchemy statement that selects the rating of a post by the user. The function returns this rating.

Parameters:

  • body – Get the post_id from the body of the request

  • user – Get the user id

  • db – Access the database

Returns:

A rating object

async src.repository.rating.refresh_rating(post: Post, db: AsyncSession)¶

The refresh_rating function takes a Post object and an AsyncSession object as arguments. It then uses the SQLAlchemy ORM to query the database for all ratings associated with that post, and calculates their average value. It then updates the rating attribute of that post with this new value, commits it to the database, and returns a refreshed version of that Post.

Parameters:

  • post – Post: Pass the post object to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A post object

PhotoShareApp repository Search¶

async src.repository.search.get_post_by_keyword(filter_by_date: bool, filter_by_rating: bool, keyword: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_post_by_keyword function takes in a keyword, and returns all posts that contain the keyword. The function also takes in two optional parameters: filter_by_date and filter_by_rating. If these are set to True, the returned posts will be sorted by date or rating respectively.

Parameters:

  • filter_by_date – bool: Filter the posts by date

  • filter_by_rating – bool: Filter the posts by rating

  • keyword – str: Filter the posts by name

  • db – AsyncSession: Connect to the database

Returns:

A list of posts that match the keyword

async src.repository.search.get_post_by_tag(filter_by_date: bool, filter_by_rating: bool, tag: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_post_by_tag function takes in a boolean value for filtering by date, a boolean value for filtering by rating, a tag name string and an async database session. It returns all posts that have the given tag.

Parameters:

  • filter_by_date – bool: Filter the posts by date

  • filter_by_rating – bool: Filter the posts by rating

  • tag – str: Filter posts by tag

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of posts with the given tag

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.search.get_post_by_user(filter_by_date: bool, filter_by_rating: bool, username: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_post_by_user function takes in a boolean value for filtering by date, a boolean value for filtering by rating, a username string and an async database session. It returns all posts made by the user with the given username.

Parameters:

  • filter_by_date – bool: Determine if the posts should be filtered by date

  • filter_by_rating – bool: Filter the posts by rating

  • username – str: Filter the posts by username

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of posts by the user with the given username

PhotoShareApp repository Tags¶

async src.repository.tags.create_tag(body: TagModel, db: AsyncSession) → Tag¶
The create_tag function creates a new tag in the database.

It takes a TagModel object as input and returns the created Tag object. If there is already an existing tag with that name, it will raise an error.

Parameters:

  • body – TagModel: Get the name of the tag from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session for the function

Returns:

A tag object

async src.repository.tags.get_all_tags(limit, offset, db: AsyncSession) → List[Tag]¶

The get_all_tags function returns a list of all tags in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – Skip a certain number of rows

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A list of tag objects

async src.repository.tags.get_or_create_tag_by_name(tag_name: str, db: AsyncSession) → Tag¶

The get_or_create_tag_by_name function takes a tag name and an async database session. It then checks if the tag exists in the database, returning it if so. If not, it creates a new Tag object with that name and returns that.

Parameters:

  • tag_name – str: Specify the name of the tag that is being created

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A tag instance

async src.repository.tags.get_tag(tag_name, db: AsyncSession) → Tag¶

The get_tag function takes a tag name and returns the corresponding Tag object. If no such tag exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • tag_name – Filter the tag table by name

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A tag object

async src.repository.tags.remove_tag(tag: Tag, db: AsyncSession)¶

The remove_tag function removes a tag from the database.

Parameters:

  • tag – Tag: Pass in the tag object that we want to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The tag that was removed

PhotoShareApp repository Transformation¶

async src.repository.transformation.get_all_url(limit: int, offset: int, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession) → List[PhotoUrl]¶
The get_all_url function returns a list of all the photo urls for a given user.
Args:

  • limit (int): The number of photos to return.

  • offset (int): The starting point in the database from which to start returning photos. This is useful for pagination purposes, so that you can get more than one page worth of results at once. For example, if you want 20 results per page and are on page 3, then your offset would be 40 because you’d skip the first 40 results in order to get the next 20 after that.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the amount of photos returned

  • offset – int: Specify how many records to skip

  • current_user – User: Get the current user’s photo urls

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of photourl objects

async src.repository.transformation.get_photo_info(id: int, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶
The get_photo_info function takes in a photo id and returns the photo’s information.
Args:

  • id (int): The ID of the photo to be retrieved.

  • current_user (User): The user who is currently logged in. This is used to ensure that only photos belonging to this user are returned.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Specify the id of the photo that we want to get information about

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A photo, but what if the user doesn’t have a photo with that id?

async src.repository.transformation.get_photo_info_qr(id: int, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶
The get_photo_info_qr function is used to get the photo url of a post.
Args:

  • id (int): The id of the post.

  • current_user (User): The user who is currently logged in and using the app.

  • db (AsyncSession): A database session object that allows us to execute SQL queries on our database tables.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Get the id of the post

  • current_user – User: Check if the user is logged in or not

  • db – AsyncSession: Make a connection to the database

Returns:

The photo url of the post

async src.repository.transformation.get_photo_url(id, current_user: User, db: AsyncSession) → List[PhotoUrl]¶
The get_photo_url function takes in a photo id and returns the url of that photo.
Args:

  • id (int): The ID of the photo to be retrieved.

  • current_user (User): The user who is making this request.

Parameters:

  • id – Identify the photo in the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of photo urls

async src.repository.transformation.update_qr(id: int, url: str, url_qr: str, db: AsyncSession)¶
The update_qr function updates the url and qr_url of a post.
Args:

  • id (int): The ID of the post to update.

  • url (str): The new URL for this post.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Get the post id from the database

  • url – str: Update the url in the database

  • url_qr:str – Update the qrcode url in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A new url and qr code for the post

PhotoShareApp repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.ban_user(username: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The ban_user function takes a username and an asyncpg database connection as arguments. It then queries the database for the user with that username, and if it finds one, sets their is_banned flag to True. The function also deletes any refresh tokens associated with that user from Redis.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Specify the username of the user to be banned

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The user object

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user that is being confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the data that is passed into the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The newly created user object

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the user to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object or none

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_username(username: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_username function takes a username and returns the user object associated with that username. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Specify the username of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A user object or none

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

PhotoShareApp routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message if the email is already confirmed or a different one if it is not

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_reset_password(token: str, password1: str, password2: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password. It takes in the token, password 1 and 2 as parameters. It then checks if the passwords are equal, if not it raises an HTTPException with status code 400 and detail &quot;Your passwords are not the same&quot;. If they are equal it gets the email from token using auth_service.get_email_from_token(token). Then it gets user by email using repository users get user by email function (repository users get user by email returns a User object). Then we set that User objects password to be what was passed in

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • password1 – str: Get the new password from the user

  • password2 – str: Make sure that the user entered the same password twice

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

A jwt, which is a json object with the following keys:

async src.routes.auth.logout(credentials: HTTPBearer = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The logout function is used to invalidate the access token and refresh token by adding them to the blacklist.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPBearer: Get the access token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a success message

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes a refresh token as input and returns an access token. The function first decodes the refresh_token to get the user’s email address, then it gets that user from our database, and checks if their stored refresh_token matches what was sent in with this request. If not, we raise an error and return a 401 Unauthorized response code (the client will need to log in again). If everything checks out, we create new tokens for this user using our auth service module and update their record in our database with these new tokens.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the access token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A new access token and refresh token

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends them an email containing a link they can click on to confirm their account.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Validate the request body against

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of our application

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(body: RequestEmail, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account with that email already exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body and convert it to a user object

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A new user object

PhotoShareApp routes Comments¶

async src.routes.comments.create_comment(body: CreateCommentModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_comment function creates a new comment.

Parameters:

  • body – CreateCommentModel: Validate the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the create_comment function

Returns:

A comment object

async src.routes.comments.delete_comment(body: CommentDeleteModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.

The function takes in a CommentDeleteModel object, which contains the id of the comment to be deleted. It also takes in an optional current_user parameter, which is used to verify that only users who created comments can delete them. Finally, it takes in an optional db parameter for accessing the database.

Parameters:

  • body – CommentDeleteModel: Get the comment id from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the following keys:

async src.routes.comments.update_comment(body: CommentUpdateModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_comment function updates a comment in the database.

The function takes in a CommentUpdateModel object, which contains the id of the comment to be updated and its new body. It also takes in an optional current_user parameter, which is used to verify that the user making this request is authorized to do so. Finally, it takes an optional db parameter for dependency injection purposes.

Parameters:

  • body – CommentUpdateModel: Get the data from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is making the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the

Returns:

A commentmodel object

PhotoShareApp routes Photo URL QR¶

async src.routes.photo_url_qr.get_photos_info()¶

The get_photos_info function returns a list of dictionaries containing information about the photos in the Cloudinary account. The function uses the resources() method from Cloudinary’s Python SDK to return a dictionary with all of this information.

Returns:

A dictionary of all the photos in your cloudinary account

async src.routes.photo_url_qr.get_url_photo(public_id: str)¶
The get_url_photo function takes a public_id as an argument and returns the url of the photo with that public_id.
Args:

  • public_id (str): The unique identifier for a photo in Cloudinary.

Parameters:

public_id – str: Specify the name of the image in cloudinary

Returns:

A tuple with two values

PhotoShareApp routes Posts¶

async src.routes.posts.add_tags_to_post(body: TagUpdate, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The add_tags_to_post function adds tags to a post.

The function takes in the body of the request, which contains an array of tag ids and a post id. It also takes in user information from auth_service and database connection information from get_db().

Parameters:

  • body – TagUpdate: Get the tag_id from the request body

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A post object

src.routes.posts.checker(data: str = Form(PydanticUndefined))¶

The checker function is a custom validator that will be used to validate the JSON data sent in the request body. It uses FastAPI’s Form() parameter type, which will automatically parse and deserialize JSON into Python objects. The checker function then passes this data to PostModel’s model_validate_json method, which will raise a ValidationError if any of the fields fail validation.

Parameters:

data – str: Get the json data from the request body

Returns:

A dict with the validated data

async src.routes.posts.create_post(body: PostModel = Depends(checker), file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_post function creates a new post in the database.

It takes in a PostModel object, an UploadFile object, and the current_user as arguments. The function then uploads the file to cloudinary using its unique path (which is generated by uuid4). Then it generates an image url for that file and saves it to our database.

Parameters:

  • body – PostModel: Validate the request body

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request and

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

The created post with the new id

async src.routes.posts.get_post(post_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_post function is used to retrieve a single post from the database. It takes an integer as its only argument, which represents the ID of the post to be retrieved. It returns a Post object if successful.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: Specify the type of the parameter, and it is also used to specify that

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database connection

Returns:

A post object

async src.routes.posts.get_posts(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_posts function returns a list of posts.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

All posts in the database

async src.routes.posts.remove_post(post_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The remove_post function removes a post from the database.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: Specify the post id

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The removed post

async src.routes.posts.update_post(body: PostModel, post_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_post function updates a post in the database.

It takes an id of the post to update, and a body containing new values for that post. The user must be logged in to use this function.

Parameters:

  • body – PostModel: Get the data from the request body

  • post_id – int: Get the post id from the path

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A postmodel object

PhotoShareApp routes Rating¶

async src.routes.rating.delete_rate(body: FindRateModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The delete_rate function deletes a rate from the database.

Deletes an existing rate in the database by its id and user_name. The post’s rating is also updated to reflect this change.

Parameters:

  • body – FindRateModel: Get the post_id and username of the rate that we want to delete

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A post object

async src.routes.rating.get_ratings(post_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_ratings function returns the ratings for a given post.

Parameters:

  • post_id – int: Specify the type of the parameter

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A post object, which contains the ratings

async src.routes.rating.rate_post(body: RateModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The rate_post function is used to rate a post.
It takes the following parameters:

  • body: The RateModel object containing the rating and post_id of the rated post.

  • current_user: The User object representing the user who is making this request. This parameter will be automatically filled in by FastAPI’s dependency injection system, which uses OpenAPI to determine what type of data should be passed into each function parameter (in this case, it knows that we need a User object). We also use Depends(auth_service.get_current_user) to tell FastAPI that it should call our auth

Parameters:

  • body – RateModel: Get the post_id and rating from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session

Returns:

The rating of the post after adding a new rate

PhotoShareApp routes Search¶

async src.routes.search.get_post_by_keyword(filter_by_date: bool = True, filter_by_rating: bool = False, username: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_post_by_keyword function is used to get a post by keyword.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • filter_by_date (bool): A boolean value that determines whether or not to filter posts by date.

  • filter_by_rating (bool): A boolean value that determines whether or not to sort posts by rating.

  • username (str): The username of the user whose post you want returned.

Parameters:

  • filter_by_date – bool: Filter the posts by date

  • filter_by_rating – bool: Filter the posts by rating

  • username – str: Get the username of the user that is being searched for

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of posts that contain the keyword in their title or description

async src.routes.search.get_post_by_tag(filter_by_date: bool = True, filter_by_rating: bool = False, tag: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_post_by_tag function is used to retrieve a post by tag.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • filter_by_date (bool): If true, will return posts sorted by date. Default value is True.

  • filter_by_rating (bool): If true, will return posts sorted by rating. Default value is False.

  • tag (str): The name of the tag that you want to search for a post with.

Parameters:

  • filter_by_date – bool: Filter the posts by date

  • filter_by_rating – bool: Filter the posts by rating

  • tag – str: Specify the tag that we want to search for

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of posts that match the tag

PhotoShareApp routes Tags¶

async src.routes.tags.create_tag(body: TagModel, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_tag function creates a new tag in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – TagModel: Specify the type of data that is expected in the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the repository

Returns:

A tagmodel object

async src.routes.tags.get_all_tags(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_all_tags function returns a list of all tags in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of tags returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of tags returned

  • offset – int: Offset the query by a certain amount

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of tags

async src.routes.tags.get_or_create_tag_by_name(name: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_or_create_tag_by_name function is a helper function that will either return an existing tag

or create a new one if it doesn’t exist. This is useful for when you want to add tags to an article, but don’t want to have duplicate tags in the database.

Parameters:

  • name – str: Specify the name of the tag to be created

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A tuple of the tag object and a boolean value

async src.routes.tags.remove_tag(tag_name: str, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The remove_tag function removes a tag from the database.

Parameters:

  • tag_name – str: Get the tag name from the request

  • user – User: Get the user object from the token

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A tag object (see the repository_tags)

PhotoShareApp routes Transformation¶

async src.routes.transformation.create_qr(url_transform)¶

The create_qr function takes a url_transform as an argument and returns a QR code image. The function uses the qrcode library to create a QR code object, add data to it, make it fit the size of the data added, and then create an image from that object. The function then saves that image into an io BytesIO object which is returned by the function.

Parameters:

url_transform – Pass the url to be transformed into a qr code

Returns:

A byte array

async src.routes.transformation.info_all_transformation()¶
The info_all_transformation function returns a dictionary of all the transformations that are available in this

module. The keys are the names of each transformation, and the values are dictionaries containing information about each transformation. Each value dictionary contains three key-value pairs: ‘description’, which is a string describing what the function does; ‘parameters’, which is an array of strings listing all parameters for that function; and ‘returns’, which describes what type(s) will be returned by that function.

Returns:

A list of all transformations

async src.routes.transformation.ping_cloudinary()¶
The ping_cloudinary function is a simple function that pings the Cloudinary API to ensure it’s working properly.

It returns a dictionary with information about the ping.

Returns:

A dictionary

async src.routes.transformation.remove_qrcode(id: int, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Creates a database query to obtain information about all photo links of a registered user.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Post number with photo for transformation.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve post for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Links to transform photos

Return type:

List[PhotoResponse]

async src.routes.transformation.show_all_url(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The show_all_url function returns a list of all the URLs in the database.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate through results. The user parameter is used to ensure that only URLs belonging to the current user are returned.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • ge – Set the minimum value of a parameter

  • le – Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before starting to return the results

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of a parameter

  • user – User: Get the user from the auth_service

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

All the urls of a user

async src.routes.transformation.show_photo_url(id: int, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The show_photo_url function returns the photo url of a contact.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Get the id of the contact

  • user – User: Get the current user, and the db: asyncsession parameter is used to get a database session

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A string

async src.routes.transformation.transformation_photo(id: int, create_qrcode: bool, transformation_1: str, transformation_2: str | None = None, transformation_3: str | None = None, transformation_4: str | None = None, transformation_5: str | None = None, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The transformation_photo function takes the id of a photo, and returns the original url, the transformed url and qr code for this photo.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Identify the photo in the database

  • create_qrcode – bool: Create a qr code for the transformed image

  • transformation_1 – str: Specify the first transformation

  • transformation_2 – str | None: Pass the transformation_2 parameter to the function

  • transformation_3 – str | None: Specify that the transformation_3 parameter is optional

  • transformation_4 – str | None: Pass the transformation_4 parameter to the function

  • transformation_5 – str | None: Pass the fifth transformation

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The original photo url, the transformed photo url and the qr code url

async src.routes.transformation.url_qr_prefix(list_tr)¶
The url_qr_prefix function takes a list of strings and returns the concatenation of all non-None elements in that list.

This is used to create the prefix for a QR code URL, which will be appended with an ID number.

Parameters:

list_tr – Store the list of parameters that are used in the url_qr_prefix function

Returns:

The prefix of the url, which is the first part of a url

PhotoShareApp routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the

get_current_user endpoint. It takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file uploaded by the user, and uses it to update their avatar URL on Cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

The current user

async src.routes.users.get_user_profile(username: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_profile function is a GET request that returns the profile of a user. The username parameter is required and must be unique. The db parameter uses the get_db function to connect to the database.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username from the path

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with the user’s profile information

async src.routes.users.request_email(username: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The request_email function is used to ban a user.

The function takes in the username of the user that needs to be banned and returns a boolean value indicating if the operation was successful or not.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username of the user that is to be banned

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session

Returns:

A user object

async src.routes.users.update_user_profile(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_user_profile function updates a user’s profile.
Args:

  • body (UserSchema): The UserSchema object containing the new data for the user.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional): [description]. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional): [description]. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the connection to the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A user object

PhotoShareApp services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=23131,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

  • data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that you want to encode in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created by encoding the data with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, and adding an iat (issued at) timestamp and exp (expiration) timestamp to it.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Encode the token

Returns:

A token

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

  • data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time in seconds until the token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It will raise an exception if the token is invalid or expired. If it’s valid, it will return a user email.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user object if it exists, otherwise it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses PyJWT to decode the token, which is then used to retrieve the email address from its payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Store the token that is passed in from the route

Returns:

The email address of the user who is trying to verify their account

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that we want to hash

Returns:

A hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method belong to the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password stored in the database to the plain text password that is entered by a user

Returns:

A boolean value

PhotoShareApp services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str, type: str | None = None)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their account.
Args:

  • email (str): The user’s email address.

  • username (str): The username of the user who is registering for an account.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server

  • type – str | None: Determine the type of email to be sent

Returns:

A coroutine object
